Description: Both models face SQL Injection and XSS vulnerabilities due to user input handling.
Both models utilize multi-factor authentication (MFA) to secure user accounts.
Similar patterns of Denial of Service (DoS) attacks are observed, targeting system availability.
Both models are susceptible to Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attacks due to session management issues.
Both models emphasize the importance of encrypting sensitive data at rest and in transit.
Similar patterns of Insecure Direct Object References (IDOR) attacks are noted, allowing unauthorized access to resources.
Both models must comply with PCI DSS regulations regarding sensitive data handling.
Both models implement logging and monitoring to detect suspicious activities.
Both models are vulnerable to Sensitive Data Exposure due to improper data handling.
Similar patterns of Authentication Bypass attacks are observed, allowing unauthorized access.
